channel.title: Component Definition Model on OSCAL
channel.description: Recent content in Component Definition Model on OSCAL

item.title: Component Definition Model JSON Format Outline
item.description: + component-definition: [1]{… } - component-definition: [1]{ + metadata: [1]{… }, - metadata: [1]{ title: markup-line [1], published: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], last-modified: dateTime-with-timezone [1], version: string [1], oscal-version: string [1], + revision-history: [0 to ∞]{… }, - revision-history: [0 to ∞]{ title: markup-line [0 or 1], published: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], last-modified: dateTime-with-timezone [0 or 1], version: string [0 or 1], oscal-version: string [0 or 1],

item.title: Component Definition Model JSON Format Reference
item.description: Schema download oscal_component_schema.json Schema version 1.0.0-milestone3 Short name oscal-component The OSCAL Implementation Component format can be used to describe the implementation of controls in a component or a set of components grouped as a capability. A component can be either a technical component, or a documentary component. A technical component is a component that is implemented in hardware (physical or virtual) or software. A documentary component is a component implemented in a document, such as a process, procedure, or policy.

item.title: OSCAL Component Definition Model XML Format Outline
item.description: + <component-definition> [1]… </component-definition> - <component-definition> [1] + <metadata> [1]… </metadata> - <metadata> [1] <title>markup-line</title> [1] <published>dateTime-with-timezone</published> [0 or 1] <last-modified>dateTime-with-timezone</last-modified> [1] <version>string</version> [1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version> [1] + <revision-history>[0 or 1]… </revision-history> - <revision-history>[0 or 1] + <revision> [1 to ∞]… </revision> - <revision> [1 to ∞] <title>markup-line</title> [0 or 1] <published>dateTime-with-timezone</published> [0 or 1] <last-modified>dateTime-with-timezone</last-modified> [0 or 1] <version>string</version> [0 or 1] <oscal-version>string</oscal-version> [0 or 1]

item.title: OSCAL Component Definition Model XML Format Reference
item.description: Schema download oscal_component_schema.xsd Schema version 1.0.0-milestone3 Short name oscal-component XML namespace http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal/1.0 The OSCAL Implementation Component format can be used to describe the implementation of controls in a component or a set of components grouped as a capability. A component can be either a technical component, or a documentary component. A technical component is a component that is implemented in hardware (physical or virtual) or software. A documentary component is a component implemented in a document, such as a process, procedure, or policy.
